platforms.name: Cursor
platforms.description: Cursor is an AI-first code editor designed to deeply integrate artificial intelligence into the software development workflow. It is built on a modified version of VS Code and features a powerful AI agent that can understand codebase context, generate and edit code across multiple files, and answer complex questions about a project. It uniquely positions itself as a true 'pair programmer' by allowing developers to chat with, command, and collaborate with AI directly within their editor, moving beyond simple autocomplete to a more interactive and contextual coding experience.
keyFeatures: AI Chat in Editor: Directly chat with an AI (powered by GPT-4 and Claude 3) about your codebase, ask questions, and get explanations.
Agent Mode: Issue high-level natural language commands (e.g., 'add user authentication') and the AI agent plans and executes changes across relevant files.
Intelligent Completions: Context-aware code suggestions that understand your project's libraries and patterns, not just the current file.

platforms.name: Codeium

keyFeatures: AI-powered autocomplete supporting 70+ programming languages and 40+ IDEs (VS Code, JetBrains, etc.)
Contextual chat interface for asking questions, generating code blocks, and explaining code
Semantic code search across entire codebase using natural language queries

platforms.name: GitHub Copilot
platforms.description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered pair programmer that provides real-time code completions, function suggestions, and entire code blocks directly within integrated development environments (IDEs). It leverages OpenAI's Codex model, trained on billions of lines of public code, to understand context and generate syntactically correct suggestions across dozens of programming languages and frameworks. It uniquely integrates directly into a developer's workflow, acting as an autocomplete on steroids, and is designed to boost productivity for individual developers and teams by reducing boilerplate code and accelerating development cycles.
keyFeatures: Real-time, line-by-line code suggestions and completions as you type
Support for dozens of languages including Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Go, Java, and C++
Direct integration with Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, and Neovim

It uniquely combines an accessible, zero-setup workspace with powerful AI assistance and one-click deployment, targeting learners, educators, and developers seeking a fast, collaborative coding workflow.

Team-level model training on private codebases
